text: Bexley Football Club is a football club based in Bexley, London, England. They are currently members of the Kent County League Division One West. ==History== Bexley were formed in 1884, becoming registered with the Football Association in 1886. In 1927, Bexley became a senior club. In the 1939–40 season, Bexley entered the FA Cup for the first time, beating Gravesend United 3–1, however their progress in the cup was halted due to World War II. On 24 May 1946, Bexley amalgamated Bexley United into the club. In 1965, Bexley joined the Greater London League, becoming founder members of the London Spartan League in 1975, leaving the league in 1982. In 2010, Bexley joined the Kent County League from the South London Football Alliance, winning promotion to the Premier Division in 2015. In 2019, the club was relegated to the Division One West. ==Ground== The club currently play at St Mary's Recreation Ground in Bexley. ==Records== *Best FA Cup performance: Preliminary round, 1947–48 *Best FA Vase performance: Second round, 1974–75 ==References== Category:Association football clubs established in 1884 Category:1884 establishments in England Category:Football clubs in England Category:Football clubs in London Category:Sport in the London Borough of Bexley Category:Greater London League Category:Spartan League Category:Southern Counties East Football League Category:South London Football Alliance Category:Kent County League
title: Bexley F.C.
